Finding aid updated as part of the College Archives Survey

did.abstract: Postcards depicting various campus buildings and grounds and local scenes. Images of the Grecourt gates, Paradise Pond, campus houses and administrative and teaching buildings.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The materials in this collection have been accumulated over the years from various sources.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Postcard Collection contains cancelled and unmarked postcards dating from the college's early years to the present with the bulk of the collection falling between 1900 and 1950. The postcards are black and white, monochrome and color; some of them contain written messages. The postcards depict various campus and local scenes including most of the campus buildings and landmarks; local landmarks, including private homes and public areas in the pioneer valley; and various events, people and places important to the college. Included in the collection are sets and a booklet of postcards picturing the campus and Northampton. Of special interest are images of the WAVES, Grecourt gates (France) and President Calvin Coolidge's house. One item of particular interest is a special issue postcard of Northampton scenes, filed under "Northampton environs," that features an accordion style, pop-out section.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The postcards are arranged alphabetically by subject.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Historical Postcard Collection, Smith College Archives, CA-MS-00003, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

altformavail.head: Additional Formats
altformavail.p: Images from this collection are also available online as part of the Five College Archives Digital Access Project.

accruals.head: Additions to the Collection
accruals.p: Additions to these records arrive in the College Archives on a regular basis. Please contact the College Archives for the most up-to-date information.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional materials may also be found in 80. Alumnae Files, Individual Scrapbooks, 22. Buildings and Grounds, and on the web at http://clio.fivecolleges.edu/smith/.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research according to the regulations of the Smith College Archives.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Smith College retains copyright of materials created as part of its business operations; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Smith College, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The materials in this collection have been accumulated over the years from various sources.
